definition: lit. when a rat crosses the street, people chase it down (idiom)/fig. everyone detests a lowlife
pinyin: lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3

definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
stinking reputation/notorious far and wide
"the four pests", i.e. rats, flies, mosquitoes, and sparrows/see also 打麻雀運動|打麻雀运动[Da3 Ma2 que4 Yun4 dong4]
lit. a dog who catches mice/to be meddlesome (idiom)
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
rabbits don't have long tails (idiom)/its days are numbered/won't last long
pinyin: tu4 zi5 wei3 ba5 chang2 bu5 liao3

definition: lit. flies do not attack an intact egg (idiom)/fig. no smoke without a fire
pinyin: cang1 ying5 bu4 ding1 wu2 feng4 dan4

definition: crowing like a cock and stealing like a dog (idiom)/bag of tricks/useful talents
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
lit. people fear getting famous like pigs fear fattening up (for the slaughter)/fig. fame has its price
pinyin: ren2 pa4 chu1 ming2 zhu1 pa4 zhuang4

definition: lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
lit. killing the chicken to scare the monkey (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
lit. a monkey wearing a hat (idiom)/fig. worthless person in imposing attire
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
